column3: Orange Coast College (OCC) is a community college in Orange County\\
column5: United States. It was founded in 1947\\
column6: with its first classes opening in the fall of 1948. It provides two-year associate of art and science degrees\\
column8: and lower-division classes transferable to other colleges and universities. The school enrolls approximately 24\\
column9: 000 undergraduate students. In terms of population size\\
column10: Orange Coast College is the third largest college in Orange County. It is located in Costa Mesa\\
column12: about 40 miles (64 km) south of Los Angeles.

column8: is a public research university located in Irvine\\
column12: and one of the 10 campuses in the University of California (UC) system. UC Irvine offers 80 undergraduate degrees and 98 graduate and professional degrees. The university is designated as having very high research activity in the Carnegie Classification of Institutions of Higher Education\\
column13: and in fiscal year 2013 had $348 million in research and development expenditures according to the National Science Foundation.[7] UC Irvine became a member of the Association of American Universities in 1996\\
column14: and is the youngest university to hold membership.

column5: Fullerton (also known as CSUF or Cal State Fullerton) is a public research university located in Fullerton\\

column7: 200 it has the largest student body out of the 23-campus California State University ("CSU") system\\
